docs.title: Publication

• Chen TY, Du Y, Fang X, Xing F, Ji Q. Isoflurane anesthesia regulates transcription of RORα and Rev-erbα genes and their circadian rhythm changes in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex of mice. Chin J Neuromed. 2021.

  • Chen WY, Qian Y, Chen TY, Gu XP. Research Progress of CD4+T Cells-mediated Regulation of Neuroinflammation Involved in Neurodegenerative Diseases. Zhongguo Yi Xue Ke Xue Yuan Xue Bao. 2021 Aug;43(4):628-633. Chinese. doi: 10.3881/j.issn.1000-503X.13146. PMID: 34494536.

docs.title: Project 1: Isoflurane anesthesia regulates transcription of RORα and Rev-erbα genes and their circadian rhythm changes in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex of mice
docs.text:
Participant (Instructed by) Nanjing, China, 2021

  • Research Objective: To investigate the effects of isoflurane anesthesia on the transcription levels of clock genes RORα and Rev-erbα and their circadian rhythm changes in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex of mice.
  • Research Outcome:
    • RORα mRNA expression is upregulated in the hippocampus and downregulated in the cerebral cortex.
    • Rev-erbα mRNA expression decreased in the cerebral cortex.
    • The circadian rhythm of RORα and Rev-erbα mRNA expressions in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex shifted significantly upon isoflurane anesthesia administration.
    • Summary: Isoflurane anesthesia can induce the changes of RORα andRev-erbα transcription levels and circadian rhythm changes in the hippocampus and cerebral cortex of mice.

docs.title: Project 2: Effect of melatonin pretreatment on TRF1 protein in human neuroblastoma cells treated with isoflurane
docs.text:
Participant (Instructed by) Nanjing, China, 2022

  • Research Objective: To observe the effect of melatonin pretreatment on TRF1 in isoflurane-treated human neuroblastoma cells (SHSY-5Y).
  • Research Outcome:
    • The protein levels of p-Akt (Ser473) and TRF1 in SH-SY5Y cells treated with 100 nmol/L concentration of melatonin and 1.5% isoflurane were significantly increased.
    • The PI3K (p110α) selective inhibitor BYL719 can inhibit the increase of p-Akt and TRF1 caused by melatonin in SH-SY5Y cells.
    • Summary: Melatonin pretreatment significantly up-regulates the expression of TRF1 protein in SHSY-5Y cells after isoflurane treatment, whose mechanism may be related to PI3K/Akt signaling pathway.

docs.title: Project 3: Investigation into the correlation between chronic restraint stress and alterations in the expression of genes within the hippocampal region.
Project 4: Study on the relationship between human physiological parameters and facial video information.
Project 5: Examination of the variations in gene expression within immune cells across anesthesiologists with differing levels of professional experience.
Project 6: Investigation into the Effects of SCOP Overexpression on Alterations in Circadian Sleep Rhythms.
Medical Internship, Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital, Jan. 2013 - Jan. 2014
docs.text:
• Rotation: Anesthesiology (6 months), Electrocardiogram Room (ER, 1 month), Emergency Department (ED, 1 month), Department of Critical Care Medicine (ICU, 2 months), Obstetrics and Gynecology (OB/GYN, 1 month), Geriatrics (1 month).
  • Acquired knowledge and skills:
    • The application of general anesthesia in the fields of Otolaryngology, Gynecology, Orthopedics, General Surgery, and Urology.
    • Intraoperative and postoperative management and regulation of essential vital signs.
    • Performing electrocardiogram examinations for patients and interpreting electrocardiogram results.
    • Proficiency in the diagnosis and treatment process for emergency patients, along with basic life sign support procedures.
    • Respiratory support treatment for critically ill patients.

docs.text:
• Rotation: Anesthesiology (26 months), Intensive Care Unit (ICU), Emergency Department (ED, 1 month), Division of Pain Medicine (2 months), Cardiology Department (2 months), Respiratory Medicine Department (2 months)
  • Acquired knowledge and skills:*

    • Further study of anesthesia for critically ill patients and perioperative management processes.

docs.title: Experimental Skills
docs.text:
• Surgery: Collection of Whole Blood from Adults and Pediatrics.
  • Clinical Trial:
    • Application of artificial intelligence in human facial features and physiological parameter characterization (Collecting information from 5000 subjects).
    • Take a leading role in the writing of Ethical Review.
    • Obtain good clinical practice (GCP) certification.
  • Experiments in mice: Long-term anesthesia of mice; Installation of Electroencephalogram (EEG) systems (pinnacle), and measurement of EEG; Generation of restraint stress experimental mouse model; Morris water maze test; Embedding of motion electrodes for circadian rhythm experiments; Extraction of mouse cerebral cortex and hippocampal tissues; Establishing Mouse Model of Diabetes; Brain tissue sectioning.
  • Experiments with cells: Primary Neuronal Cell Isolation; Neuronal Cell cryopreservation, recovery, culture, drug intervention and harvest; Human blood cell centrifugation and white blood cell extraction.
  • Biochemistry experiments: Western Blot (WB); Real-Time Quantitative Reverse Transcription PCR (qRT-PCR); Flow Cytometry.
